intro: Monticalia albipanquei, commonly known as the white-veined monticalia, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The species is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent white veins. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Monticalia albipanquei is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
